Title: position(s1 IN s2)
Description: search for string s1 in string s2, when found return the position in s2 of the first match, when not found return 0

Title: repeat(s, nr)
Description: repeat string s the specified nr of times

Title: replace(s, srch, repl)
Description: replace occurrences of string srch in string s by string repl

Title: right(s, int n)
Description: return last n characters in the string

Title: rpad(s, int)
Description: fill up the string to length len by appending spaces. If the string is already longer than length then it is truncated (on the right).

Title: rpad(s1, int len, s2)
Description: fill up the string s1 to length len by appending the characters s2. If the string s1 is already longer than length then it is truncated (on the right).

Title: rtrim(s)
Description: remove trailing whitespace characters from string s

Title: rtrim(s1, s2)
Description: remove trailing s2 strings from string s1

Title: space(nr)
Description: generates a string with nr spaces

Title: splitpart(s, sep, n)
Description: extract substring from string s by spliting on separator string sep the field before nth occurrence. n must be greater than zero

Title: "between"(arg_1 any, arg_2 any, arg_3 any, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)
Feature: "between"(arg_1 any, arg_2 any, arg_3 any, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)
Description: is arg1 between arg2 and arg3

Title: sql_max(s1, s2)
Description: alphabetically ordered last string value of strings s1 and s2

Title: sql_min(s1, s2)
Description: alphabetically ordered first string value of strings s1 and s2

Title: startswith(s1, s2)
Description: whether string s1 starts with string s2. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: startswith(s1, s2, icase)
Description: whether string s1 starts with string s2 matching case insenstive when icase is true, case sensitive when icase is false. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: substr(s, startpos)
Description: extract substring starting from position startpos

Title: substr(s, startpos, count)
Description: extract substring starting from position startpos for count characters

Title: substring(s, startpos)
Description: extract substring starting from position startpos

Title: substring(s, startpos, count)
Description: extract substring starting from position startpos for count characters

Title: trim(s)
Description: remove leading and trailing whitespace characters from string s

Title: trim(s1, s2)
Description: remove leading and trailing s2 strings from string s1

Title: coalesce(arg1, arg2, ...)
Description: returns the first non-NULL value in the list, or NULL if all args are NULL. At least two parameters must be passed.

Title: "truncate"(s, n_chars)
Description: truncate the string s to a maximum of n_chars characters. Note: the function name truncate need to be surrounded by double quotes.

Title: ucase(s)
Description: convert string s to upper case

Title: upper(s)
Description: convert string s to upper case

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2)
Description: Compute the 'Levenshtein distance' where insertion/deletion and replacement costs are all 1

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2, id, r)
Description: compute the 'Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions or substitutions) required to change one word into the other.

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2, int id, int r, int t)
Feature: levenshtein(s1, s2, int id, int r, int t)
Description: compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions, substitutions and transpositions) required to change one word into the other.

Title: jarowinkler(s1, s2)
Description: compute the 'Jaro-Winkler similarity' between two strings returning a double between 0 (exact match) and 1 (no similarity)

Title: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2)
Description: Compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' where insertion/deletion, replacement and transposition costs are all 1

Title: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2, int id, int r, int t)
Feature: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2, int id, int r, int t)
Description: compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions or substitutions) required to change one word into the other.

Title: editdistance(s1, s2)
Description: compute the 'distance' between two strings returning an integer between 0 (equal) and n (largest distance) where n is the length of largest string

Title: {fn IFNULL(arg1, arg2)}
Description: returns arg1 when when arg1 IS NOT NULL else returns arg2

Title: editdistance2(s1, s2)
Description: compute the 'distance2' between two strings returning an integer between 0 (equal) and n (largest distance) where n is the length of largest string

Title: soundex(s)
Description: computes the Soundex code from string s using a phonetic algorithm

Title: difference(s1, s2)
Description: converts two strings s1 and s2 to their soundex codes and reports the number of different code positions. Since soundex codes have four characters, the result ranges from zero to four, with zero being an exact match and four being no match.

Title: qgramnormalize(s)
Description: normalisation of a string s. Converts letters to uppercase and removes all characters not in a..zA..Z0..9 or space

Title: contains(s1, s2)
Description: whether string s1 constains string s2. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: contains(s1, s2, icase)
Description: whether string s1 constains string s2 matching case insenstive when icase is true, case sensitive when icase is false. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep, int trans)
Feature: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep, int trans)
Description: Compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions/deletions, substitutions and transpositions) required to change one word into the other. Variable costs of insertions/deletions, substitutions and transpositions, with insdel, rep and trans respectively

Title: endswith(s1, s2)
Description: whether string s1 ends with string s2. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: endswith(s1, s2, icase)
Description: whether string s1 ends with string s2 matching case insenstive when icase is true, case sensitive when icase is false. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep)
Feature: levenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep)
Description: Compute the 'Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions/deletions or substitutions) required to change one word into the other. Variable costs of insertions/deletions or substitutions, with insdel and rep respectively.

Title: ifthenelse(boolean arg1, arg2, arg3)
Description: when arg1 expression evaluates to true then return arg2 else arg3

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep, int trans)
Feature: levenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep, int trans)
Description: compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions, substitutions and transpositions) required to change one word into the other.

Title: length(blob)
Description: number of bytes in binary string blob

Title: octet_length(blob)
Description: number of bytes in binary string blob

Title: century(date)
Description: extract century from a date or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: current_time()
Description: get current time with time zone

Title: current_timestamp()
Description: get current timestamp (date and time and fractions) with time zone

Title: curtime()
Description: get current time with time zone

Title: sys.date_to_str(date, format_str)
Description: convert date value to a string using format_str. See format specifiers

Title: sys.date_trunc(field_str, timestamp)
Description: Truncate a timestamp to granularity specified bij field_str. Allowed values for field_str are 'millennium', 'century', 'decade', 'year', 'quarter', 'month', 'week', 'day', 'hour', 'minute', 'second', 'milliseconds', 'microseconds'.

Title: "day"(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract month day nr (1..31) of a date or timestamp or timestamptz. same as: dayofmonth(date)

Title: "day"(sec_interval)
Description: compute nr of days and truncate it to an integer

Title: {fn DAYNAME(dt_or_ts)}
Description: extract day name in current locale of a date or timestamp or timestamptz. This function requires the ODBC escape sequence notation.

Title: dayofmonth(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract month day nr (1..31) of a date or timestamp or timestamptz. same as: "day"(date)

Title: dayofweek(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract week day nr (1..7) of a date or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: dayofyear(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract year day nr (1..366) of a date or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: decade(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract decade nr of a date or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: sys.epoch(int seconds)
Description: add number of seconds to timestamp '1970-01-01 00:00:00.0'

Title: sys.epoch(decimal(18,3) seconds)
Description: add number of seconds to timestamp '1970-01-01 00:00:00.0'

Title: nullif(arg1, arg2)
Description: returns NULL if arg1 = arg2 is true, otherwise returns arg1. Equivalent to: CASE WHEN arg1 = arg2 THEN NULL ELSE arg1 END

Title: sys.epoch(timestamp)
Description: convert timestamp (or timestamptz) to nr of seconds since '1970-01-01 00:00:00.0'

Title: epoch_ms(dt_or_tm_or_ts_or_interval)
Description: convert date or time or timestamp or interval to number of milliseconds since '1970-01-01 00:00:00.0'

Title: extract(field from dt_value)
Description: extract a specific field from a date or time or timestamp. Supported keywords for field are: CENTURY, DECADE, YEAR, QUARTER, MONTH, WEEK, DAY, DOW, DOY, HOUR, MINUTE and SECOND.

Title: greatest(x, y)
Description: greatest (highest) value of x and y (same as sql_max(x,y))

Title: "hour"(tm_or_ts)
Description: extract hour nr (0..23) of a time or timetz or timestamp or timestamptz or sec_interval

Title: least(x, y)
Description: least (lowest) value of x and y (same as sql_min(x,y))

Title: local_timezone()
Description: get local time zone as represented in seconds

Title: localtime()
Description: get current local time without time zone

Title: localtimestamp()
Description: get current local timestamp (date and time and fractions) without time zone

Title: "minute"(tm_or_ts)
Description: extract minutes (0..59) of a time or timetz or timestamp or timestamptz or sec_interval

Title: "like"(s, pat, escp, isen)
Description: match pcre pattern 'pat' on string 's' using escape character 'escp' to escape wildcards, and flag 'isen' for case insensitive matches. when matched return true else false.

Title: "month"(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract month nr (1..12) of a date or timestamp or timestamptz or month_interval

Title: {fn MONTHNAME(dt_or_ts)}
Description: extract month name in current locale of a date or timestamp or timestamptz. This function requires the ODBC escape sequence notation.

Title: now()
Description: get current timestamp (date and time and fractions) with time zone

Title: quarter(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract quarter nr (1..4) of a date or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: "second"(tm_or_ts)
Description: extract seconds (0.000 .. 59.999999) of a time or timetz or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: sql_add(dt_or_ts, month_interval)
Description: add an integer month interval value to a date or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: sql_add(dt_or_tm, sec_interval)
Description: add a decimal seconds interval value to a date or time or timetz or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: sql_max(x, y)
Description: greatest (highest) value of x and y (same as greatest(x,y))

Title: sql_min(x, y)
Description: least (lowest) value of x and y(same as least(x,y))

Title: not_like(s, pat, escp, isen)
Description: match pcre pattern 'pat' on string 's' using escape character 'escp' to escape wildcards, and flag 'isen' for case insensitive matches. when matched return false else true.

Title: sql_sub(date, date)
Description: subtract a date from a date returning nr of seconds between the two dates

Title: sql_sub(dt_or_ts, month_interval)
Description: subtract an integer month interval value from a date or timestamp or timestamptz

Title: sql_sub(dt_or_tm, sec_interval)
Description: subtract a decimal seconds interval value from a date or time or timetz or timestamp or timestamptz
Examples: select sql_sub(time '15:35:50', interval '3:25' minute to second)

Title: sql_sub(time, time)
Description: subtract a time from a time returning nr of seconds interval between the two times

Title: sql_sub(timestamp, timestamp)
Description: subtract a timestamp from a timestamp returning nr of seconds interval between the two timestamps

Title: sql_sub(timestamptz, timestamptz)
Description: subtract a timestamptz from a timestamptz returning nr of seconds interval between the two timestamps with time zones

Title: sql_sub(timetz, timetz)
Description: subtract a timetz from a timetz returning nr of seconds interval between the two timetzs

Title: sys.str_to_date(s, format_str)
Description: parse string s using format_str and construct a date value. See format specifiers

Title: sys.str_to_time(s, format_str)
Description: parse string s using format_str and construct a time(0) with time zone value. See format specifiers

Title: sys.str_to_timestamp(s, format_str)
Description: parse string s using format_str and construct a timestamp with time zone value. See format specifiers

Title: CAST(col_expr AS data type)
Description: converts the value of the col_expr into the specified data type

Title: sys.time_to_str(timetz, format_str)
Description: convert time with time zone value to a string using format_str. See format specifiers

Title: sys.timestamp_to_str(timestamptz, format_str)
Description: convert timestamp with time zone value to a string using format_str. See format specifiers

Title: timestampadd(dt_ts_tm, interval)
Description: add interval (month or day or second) to a timestamp (with time zone) or date or time

Title: timestampdiff(ts_tstz, ts_tstz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or two timestamps with time zone

Title: timestampdiff_day(ts_dt_tz, ts_dt_tz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or timestamps with time zone or dates

Title: timestampdiff_hour(ts_dt_tz, ts_dt_tz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or timestamps with time zone or dates

Title: timestampdiff_min(ts_dt_tz, ts_dt_tz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or timestamps with time zone or dates

Title: timestampdiff_month(ts_tm_tz, ts_tm_tz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or two timestamps with time zone

Title: timestampdiff_quarter(ts_tm_tz, ts_tm_tz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or two timestamps with time zone

Title: timestampdiff_sec(ts_dt_tz, ts_dt_tz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or timestamps with time zone or dates

Title: CONVERT(col_expr , data type)
Description: converts the value of the col_expr into the specified data type

Title: timestampdiff_week(ts_tm_tz, ts_tm_tz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or two timestamps with time zone

Title: timestampdiff_year(ts_tm_tz, ts_tm_tz)
Description: returns difference of two timestamps or two timestamps with time zone

Title: usweekofyear(date)
Description: extract us week number (1 .. 53) of a date. The US system has weeks from Sunday through Saturday, and partial weeks at the beginning and the end of the year.

Title: week(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract ISO 8601 week number (1 .. 53) of a date or timestamp or timestamptz. same as: weekofyear(date)

Title: weekofyear(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract ISO 8601 week number (1 .. 53) of a date or timestamp or timestamptz. same as: week(date)

Title: "year"(dt_or_ts)
Description: extract year number of a date or timestamp or timestamptz or month_interval

Title: sys.setmasklen(inet, int)
Description: set netmask length for inet value

Title: sys.text(inet)
Description: extract IP address and netmask length as text

Title: json.filter(js, indx)
Description: extracts a indexed component from js. The index starts at 0 for the first element.

Title: json.filter(js, pathexpr)
Description: extracts the compgonent from js that satisfied the pathexpr string. The supported JSON path expression syntax is documented at JSONPath

Title: json."integer"(js)
Description: bigint or int or smallint or tinyint
turn a number or singleton array value or singleton object element of js into an integer. Returns null if it fails.

Title: json.isarray(str)
Description: checks the string str for JSON array compliance

Title: json.isarray(js)
Description: checks the JSON value js for JSON array compliance

Title: json.isobject(str)
Description: checks the string str for JSON object compliance

Title: json.isobject(js)
Description: checks the JSON value js for JSON object compliance

Title: json.isvalid(str)
Description: checks the string str for JSON syntax compliance

Title: json.isvalid(js)
Description: checks the JSON value js for JSON validity

Title: json.keyarray(js)
Description: returns an arraylist of key tags for the top-level components of js. Note js must represent a JSON object else an error (Object expected) is reported

Title: json.length(js)
Description: returns the number of top-level components of js

Title: json.number(js)
Description: turn a number or singleton array value or singleton object tag of js into a double. Returns null if it fails.

Title: json.text(js)
Description: glue together the values in js separated by space character

Title: json.text(js, Separator str)
Description: glue together the values in js separated by Separator string

Title: json.valuearray(js)
Description: returns an arraylist of value tags for the top-level components of js. Note js must represent a JSON object else an error (Object expected) is reported

Title: json.tojsonarray(double)
Description: convert numeric values in the column/group into a json array string

Title: json.tojsonarray(clob)
Description: convert string values in the column/group into a json array string

Title: sys.getanchor(url)
Description: extract the anchor part (after the #) from the url, may return null if no achor exists

Title: sys.getbasename(url)
Description: extract the base name part (after the / excluding the extension) from the path of the url, may return null

Title: sys.getcontext(url)
Description: extract the path context part of the url

Title: sys.getdomain(url)
Description: extract the top-level domain part of the host part of the url, may return null

Title: sys.getextension(url)
Description: extract the file extension part of the url, may return null

Title: sys.getfile(url)
Description: extract the last file part of the path of the url, may return null

Title: sys.gethost(url)
Description: extract the host part of the url, may return null

Title: sys.getport(url)
Description: extract the port number part of the url, may return null

Title: sys.getprotocol(url)
Description: extract the protocol or scheme part of the url

Title: sys.getquery(url)
Description: extract the query part (after the ?) of the url, may return null

Title: sys.getroboturl(url)
Description: extract the location of the robot control file of the url

Title: sys.getuser(url)
Description: extract the user part of the url, may return null

Title: sys.isaurl(string)
Description: checks whether a character string complies to the url syntax format

Title: sys.newurl(scheme, authority, path)
Description: create a new url from three strings: scheme, authority or host and path

Title: sys.newurl(scheme, host, int port, path)
Description: create a new url from three strings and a port number as third argument

Title: sys.url_extract_host(url string, no_www bool)
Description: extract the host part of the url, may return null

Title: sys.isauuid(string)
Description: tests if the given string represents a valid uuid value and returns a boolean value true or false, or null when the input is null

Title: sys.uuid()
Description: generates and returns a new random uuid

Title: avg(numeric_expr)
Description: compute the average of the non-NULL integer/float/decimal/month_interval values in the column or group

Title: count(*)
Description: count the number of rows in the column or group including those who may have NULL values

Title: count(col_expr)
Description: count the number of non-NULL values in the column or group

Title: count(distinct col_expr)
Description: count the number of distinct non-NULL values in the column or group

Title: max(col_expr)
Description: return the maximum non-NULL value in the column or group

Title: min(col_expr)
Description: return the minimum non-NULL value in the column or group

Title: prod(numeric_expr)
Description: compute the product of the non-NULL numeric values in the column or group

Title: prod(distinct numeric_expr)
Description: compute the product of the distinct non-NULL numeric values in the column or group

Title: sum(integer_expr)
Description: compute the sum of all non-NULL integer values in the column or group

Title: sum(distinct integer_expr)
Description: compute the sum of all distinct non-NULL integer values in the column or group

Title: sum(decimal_expr)
Description: compute the sum of all non-NULL decimal values in the column or group

Title: sum(float_expr)
Description: compute the sum of all non-NULL floating point values in the column or group

Title: sum(month_interval_expr)
Description: compute the sum of all non-NULL interval month values in the column or group

Title: sum(sec_interval_expr)
Description: compute the sum of all non-NULL interval second values in the column or group

Title: listagg(col_expr)
Description: concatenate non-NULL values in a column or group into one large varchar string with values separated by a comma (the default separator). Supported from release Jun2020 (11.37.7)

Title: listagg(col_expr, separator_str)
Description: concatenate non-NULL values in a column or group into one large varchar string with values separated by separator_str. Supported from release Jun2020 (11.37.7)

Title: ceil(x)
Description: nearest integer greater than or equal to argument (same as ceiling(x))

Title: sys.group_concat(col_expr)
Description: concatenate non-NULL values in a column or group into one large string with values separated by a comma (the default separator)

Title: sys.group_concat(col_expr, separator_str)
Description: concatenate non-NULL values in a column or group into one large string with values separated by separator_str

Title: json.tojsonarray(clob)
Description: convert string values in the column or group into a json array string

Title: json.tojsonarray(double)
Description: convert numeric values in the column or group into a json array string

Title: sys.corr(numeric_a, numeric_b)
Description: return the correlation coefficient of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double) column or group numeric_a versus numeric_b

Title: sys.covar_pop(numeric_a, numeric_b)
Description: return the population covariance of numeric_expr of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double/interval) column or group numeric_a versus numeric_b. Supported from release Jun2020 (11.37.7)

Title: sys.covar_samp(numeric_a, numeric_b)
Description: return the sample covariance of numeric_expr of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double/interval) column or group numeric_a versus numeric_b. Supported from release Jun2020 (11.37.7)

Title: sys.median(col_expr)
Description: return the statistic median of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double) or temporal (date/time/timestamp/interval) column or group

Title: sys.median_avg(numeric_expr)
Description: return the statistic median average of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double) column or group

Title: sys.quantile(col_expr, percentile)
Description: return the statistic quantile of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double) or temporal (date/time/timestamp/interval) column or group. The percentile argument must be between 0.0 and 1.0

Title: ceiling(x)
Description: nearest integer greater than or equal to argument (same as ceil(x))

Title: sys.quantile_avg(numeric_expr, percentile)
Description: return the statistic quantile average of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double) column or group. The percentile argument must be between 0.0 and 1.0

Title: sys.stddev_pop(numeric_expr)
Description: return the population standard deviation of numeric_expr of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double/interval) column or group. Same as the square root of var_pop().

Title: sys.stddev_samp(numeric_expr)
Description: return the sample standard deviation of numeric_expr of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double/interval) column or group. Same as the square root of var_samp().

Title: sys.var_pop(numeric_expr)
Description: return the population standard variance of numeric_expr of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double/interval) column or group. Same as the square of stddev_pop().

Title: sys.var_samp(numeric_expr)
Description: return the sample standard variance of numeric_expr of the non-NULL values in the numeric (integer/decimal/real/double/interval) column or group. Same as the square of stddev_samp().

Title: cume_dist(value any)
Description: cumulative distribution: (number of partition rows preceding or peer with current row) / total partition rows

Title: dense_rank(value any)
Description: rank of the current row without gaps

Title: diff(value any)
Description: is the current row value different from other partition rows

Title: diff(boolean, value any)
Description: is the current row value different from other partition rows

Title: first_value(value any)
Description: returns value evaluated at the row that is the first row of the window frame

Title: lag(value any [, offset integer [, default any]])
Feature: lag(value any [, offset integer [, default any]])
Description: returns value evaluated at the row that is offset rows before the current row within the partition; if there is no such row, instead return default (which must be of the same type as value). Both offset and default are evaluated with respect to the current row. If omitted, offset defaults to 1 and default to null.

Title: last_value(value any)
Description: returns value evaluated at the row that is the last row of the window frame

Title: lead(value any [, offset integer [, default any]])
Feature: lead(value any [, offset integer [, default any]])
Description: returns value evaluated at the row that is offset rows after the current row within the partition; if there is no such row, instead return default (which must be of the same type as value). Both offset and default are evaluated with respect to the current row. If omitted, offset defaults to 1 and default to null.

Title: nth_value(value any, nth bigint)
Description: returns value evaluated at the row that is the nth row of the window frame (counting from 1); null if no such row.

Title: ntile(value any, num_buckects integer)
Description: integer ranging from 1 to the argument value, dividing the partition as equally as possible

Title: percent_rank(value any)
Description: relative rank of the current row: (rank - 1) / (total partition rows - 1)

Title: rank(value any)
Description: rank of the current row with gaps

Title: row_number(value any)
Description: number of the current row within its partition, counting from 1

Title: floor(x)
Description: nearest integer less than or equal to argument

Title: get_value_for(schema_nm, seq_nm)
Description: get current value of a sequence

Title: generate_series(first, limit)
Description: tinyint or smallint or int or bigint or hugeint
Generate a series of integer numbers, from first till limit with a increment of 1

Title: generate_series(first, limit, stepsize)
Description: tinyint or smallint or int or bigint or hugeint or real or double or decimal
Generate a series of numbers, from first till limit with increments of stepsize

Title: generate_series(first, limit, interval stepsize)
Description: Generate a series of timestamps with increments of interval stepsize

Title: greatest(x, y)
Description: greatest (highest) value of x and y (same as sql_max(x,y))

Title: least(x, y)
Description: least (lowest) value of x and y (same as sql_min(x,y))

Title: log(b, x)
Description: logarithm to base b. Note: before Oct2020 release (11.39.5) the arguments were switched, so log(x, b).

Title: "xor"(a boolean, b boolean)
Description: a OR b, but NOT, a AND b

Title: next_value_for(schema_nm, seq_nm)
Description: get current value of a sequence and increment it

Title: power(x, y)
Description: x raised to the power of y

Title: rand(seed)
Description: random integer value with seed set

Title: round(x, d)
Description: round x to d decimal places

Title: scale_down(x, y)
Description: ??? divide x by y and round to integer

Title: sign(x)
Description: sign of the argument: -1 when x is negative, 0 when x is zero, 1 when x is positive

Title: sql_max(x, y)
Description: greatest (highest) value of x and y (same as greatest(x,y))

Title: sql_min(x, y)
Description: least (lowest) value of x and y(same as least(x,y))

Title: sys.alpha(pdec double, pradius double)
Description: compute alpha 'expansion' of theta for a given declination (used by SkyServer)

Title: sys.ms_round(x double, prc int, trunc int)
Feature: sys.ms_round(x double, prc int, trunc int)
Description: round to prc decimal places and ?? truncate to trunc decimal places

Title: acos(x)
Description: arc cosine of angle x in radians

Title: asin(x)
Description: arc sine of angle x in radians

Title: atan(x)
Description: arc tangent of angle x in radians

Title: atan(x, y)
Description: arc tangent of angle x/y in radians

Title: cos(x)
Description: cosine of angle x in radians

Title: cosh(x)
Description: hyperbolic cosine of angle x in radians

Title: cot(x)
Description: cotangent of angle x in radians

Title: degrees(rad)
Description: convert radians angle value to degrees: r*180/pi() Note: before Oct2020 release (11.39.5) you need to include the sys schema prefix, so sys.degrees(rad).

Title: radians(degr)
Description: convert degrees angle value to radians: d*pi()/180 Note: before Oct2020 release (11.39.5) you need to include the sys schema prefix, so sys.radians(degr).

Title: "<="(arg1, arg2)
Description: is arg1 less than or equal to arg2

Title: sin(x)
Description: sine of angle x in radians

Title: sinh(x)
Description: hyperbolic sine of angle x in radians

Title: tan(x)
Description: tangent of angle x in radians

Title: tanh(x)
Description: hyperbolic tangent of angle x in radians

Title: ascii(s)
Description: Unicode code point of the first character of the string s

Title: asciify(s)
Description: Replace all non-ASCII characters in string s with ASCII equivalents

Title: char_length(s)
Description: number of UTF-8 characters in UTF-8 string s

Title: character_length(s)
Description: number of UTF-8 characters in UTF-8 string s

Title: charindex(substr, s)
Description: start position of substr in string s or 0 when not found

Title: charindex(substr, s, i)
Description: start position of substr in string s starting at offset i or 0 when not found

Title: ">="(arg1, arg2)
Description: is arg1 greater than or equal to arg2

Title: code(int)
Description: Unicode character for the integer code point

Title: concat(s1, s2)
Description: concatenate strings s1 and s2. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: field(s, s1, s2, s3, ...)
Description: Returns the index (position) of s in the s1, s2, s3, ... list. Returns NULL if str is not found.

Title: greatest(s1, s2)
Description: alphabetically ordered last string value of strings s1 and s2. (same as sql_max(s1, s2))

Title: insert(s1, int pos, int nr, s2)
Feature: insert(s1, int pos, int nr, s2)
Description: insert string s2 into string s1 after position pos replacing nr characters in string s1. when pos is negative it counts from the end of the string. nr must be >= 0.

Title: lcase(s)
Description: convert string s to lower case

Title: least(s1, s2)
Description: alphabetically ordered first string value of strings s1 and s2. (same as sql_min(s1, s2))

Title: left(s, int n)
Description: return first n characters in the string

Title: length(s)
Description: count number of UTF-8 characters in UTF-8 string s

Title: locate(s1, s2)
Description: locate string s1 in s2, when found return start position else 0

Title: locate(s1, s2, int pos)
Description: locate string s1 in s2 starting from position pos, when found return start position else 0

Title: lower(s)
Description: convert string s to lower case

Title: lpad(s, int len)
Description: fill up the string to length len by prepending spaces. If the string is already longer than length then it is truncated (on the right).

Title: lpad(s1, int len, s2)
Description: fill up the string s1 to length len by prepending the characters s2. If the string s1 is already longer than length then it is truncated (on the right).

Title: ltrim(s)
Description: remove leading whitespace characters from string s

Title: ltrim(s1, s2)
Description: remove leading s2 strings from string s1

Title: sys.md5(s)
Description: calculates the MD5 hash of string, returning the result as 32 character hex number

Title: sys.ms_stuff(varchar(32) s1, int pos, int nr, varchar(32) s2)
Feature: sys.ms_stuff(varchar(32) s1, int pos, int nr, varchar(32) s2)
Description: insert string s2 into string s1 at position pos replacing nr characters in string s1. If pos <= 0 or > length of s1 then an empty string is returned. nr may be negative.

Title: octet_length(s)
Description: number of bytes in UTF-8 string s

Title: patindex(pattern, s)
Description: search for pattern in string s, when found return the position of the last matched character, when not found return 0

Title: "<>"(arg1, arg2)
Description: is arg1 not equal to arg2
